verses.kjv: Therefore we ought to give the more earnest heed to the things which we have heard, lest at any time we should let them slip.
verses.web: Therefore we ought to pay greater attention to the things that were heard, lest perhaps we drift away.
verses.ct: That's why we need to hold on even more tightly to what we've heard, so we don't drift away from it.

verses.kjv: For if the word spoken by angels was stedfast, and every transgression and disobedience received a just recompence of reward;
verses.web: For if the word spoken through angels proved steadfast, and every transgression and disobedience received a just penalty,
verses.ct: After all, the message delivered through angels proved to be binding, and every violation and act of disobedience received the punishment it deserved.

verses.kjv: How shall we escape, if we neglect so great salvation; which at the first began to be spoken by the Lord, and was confirmed unto us by them that heard him;
verses.web: how will we escape if we neglect so great a salvation—which at the first having been spoken through the Lord, was confirmed to us by those who heard,
verses.ct: So how will we escape if we ignore such an incredible salvation? The Lord himself first announced it, and those who heard him directly confirmed it to us.

verses.kjv: God also bearing them witness, both with signs and wonders, and with divers miracles, and gifts of the Holy Ghost, according to his own will?
verses.web: God also testifying with them, both by signs and wonders, by various works of power and by gifts of the Holy Spirit, according to his own will?
verses.ct: God backed up their testimony with signs, wonders, all kinds of miracles, and gifts of the Holy Spirit distributed according to his own will.

verses.kjv: For unto the angels hath he not put in subjection the world to come, whereof we speak.
verses.web: For he didn’t subject the world to come, of which we speak, to angels.
verses.ct: Now, God didn't put the coming world we're talking about under the authority of angels.

verses.kjv: But one in a certain place testified, saying, What is man, that thou art mindful of him? or the son of man, that thou visitest him?
verses.web: But one has somewhere testified, saying, “What is man, that you think of him? Or the son of man, that you care for him?
verses.ct: Instead, someone testified in Scripture, saying, "What are human beings that you even think about them? What is a son of man that you care for him?

verses.kjv: Thou madest him a little lower than the angels; thou crownedst him with glory and honour, and didst set him over the works of thy hands:
verses.web: You made him a little lower than the angels. You crowned him with glory and honor.
verses.ct: You made him a little lower than the angels. You crowned him with glory and honor and put him in charge of everything you made.

verses.kjv: Thou hast put all things in subjection under his feet. For in that he put all in subjection under him, he left nothing that is not put under him. But now we see not yet all things put under him.
verses.web: You have put all things in subjection under his feet.” For in that he subjected all things to him, he left nothing that is not subject to him. But now we don’t see all things subjected to him, yet.
verses.ct: You placed all things under his feet." When God put everything under him, he left nothing outside his control. Yet right now, we don't see everything under his control yet.

verses.kjv: But we see Jesus, who was made a little lower than the angels for the suffering of death, crowned with glory and honour; that he by the grace of God should taste death for every man.
verses.web: But we see him who has been made a little lower than the angels, Jesus, because of the suffering of death crowned with glory and honor, that by the grace of God he should taste of death for everyone.
verses.ct: But we do see Jesus — who was made a little lower than the angels — now crowned with glory and honor because he suffered death, so that by God's grace he could taste death for every person.

verses.kjv: For it became him, for whom are all things, and by whom are all things, in bringing many sons unto glory, to make the captain of their salvation perfect through sufferings.
verses.web: For it became him, for whom are all things, and through whom are all things, in bringing many children to glory, to make the author of their salvation perfect through sufferings.
verses.ct: It was fitting that God, for whom and through whom everything exists, would make the pioneer of their salvation perfect through suffering as he brought many sons and daughters to glory.

verses.kjv: For both he that sanctifieth and they who are sanctified are all of one: for which cause he is not ashamed to call them brethren,
verses.web: For both he who sanctifies and those who are sanctified are all from one, for which cause he is not ashamed to call them brothers,
verses.ct: The one who makes people holy and those who are made holy all come from the same Father. That's why Jesus isn't ashamed to call them brothers and sisters.

verses.kjv: Saying, I will declare thy name unto my brethren, in the midst of the church will I sing praise unto thee.
verses.web: saying, “I will declare your name to my brothers. Among the congregation I will sing your praise.”
verses.ct: He says, "I will proclaim your name to my brothers and sisters. In the middle of the congregation I will sing your praise."

verses.kjv: And again, I will put my trust in him. And again, Behold I and the children which God hath given me.
verses.web: Again, “I will put my trust in him.” Again, “Behold, here I am with the children whom God has given me.”
verses.ct: He also says, "I will put my trust in him." And again, "Here I am, together with the children God has given me."

verses.kjv: Forasmuch then as the children are partakers of flesh and blood, he also himself likewise took part of the same; that through death he might destroy him that had the power of death, that is, the devil;
verses.web: Since then the children have shared in flesh and blood, he also himself in the same way partook of the same, that through death he might bring to nothing him who had the power of death, that is, the devil,
verses.ct: Since those children share in flesh and blood, Jesus himself took on that same human nature. He did this so that through his death he could destroy the one who holds the power of death — that is, the devil —

verses.kjv: And deliver them who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage.
verses.web: and might deliver all of them who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage.
verses.ct: and set free everyone who had lived their whole lives enslaved by the fear of death.

verses.kjv: For verily he took not on him the nature of angels; but he took on him the seed of Abraham.
verses.web: For most certainly, he doesn’t give help to angels, but he gives help to the offspring of Abraham.
verses.ct: It's clear that he didn't come to help angels. He came to help the descendants of Abraham.

verses.kjv: Wherefore in all things it behoved him to be made like unto his brethren, that he might be a merciful and faithful high priest in things pertaining to God, to make reconciliation for the sins of the people.
verses.web: Therefore he was obligated in all things to be made like his brothers, that he might become a merciful and faithful high priest in things pertaining to God, to make atonement for the sins of the people.
verses.ct: Because of this, he had to be made like his brothers and sisters in every way, so he could become a merciful and faithful high priest in service to God, making atonement for the sins of the people.

verses.kjv: For in that he himself hath suffered being tempted, he is able to succour them that are tempted.
verses.web: For in that he himself has suffered being tempted, he is able to help those who are tempted.
verses.ct: Because he himself suffered when he was tempted, he is able to help anyone who faces temptation.
